De M
r
Bodley a Mons
r
le Comte d'Essex le 5
me
la Juin 1595

page.lettertext:
fol.231r
Maie it please y
r
good L
p
, here come to visit me yester even
S
r
Robert Sidney
, whether onlie of goodwill to see me or to feele
my disposition for retorninge into
Hollande,
or to informe himself
of somw
t
els, I cannot verie well conjecture but to signifie my
suspition, I th owght it either proceeded of that w
ch
I had
written in a schedule to y
r
Lo
p
w
ch
I surmised yo
w
might
shewe, or upon his owne desire to be imploied in that
busines whereto I am perswaded my L. Tr
r
will be willinge
for all his speeches sounded, as yf he sought for some
instrucc
o
n to prepare himself to suche a purpose, howbeit
I would not seeme to finde it thoughe I cast out a
worde wherto he answeared nothinge) that I knewe
no fitter then himself to performe that
s
vice w
th
e
States.
Yf there be suche a matter towardes and y
r
Lo
p
pleased w
th
it I would be glad to help it forwarde
w
th
all incouragements unto him, as occasions are p
r
sented
beinge fullie bent for my self to goe
forwardes
on
onwardes w
th
my Course to wind my self out of the bryars w
ch
I
thought not im
tinent to signifie to y
r
Lo
p
.
